snippet: The president called the uproar over the payment, which was made public at the time as part of a landmark nuclear pact, “the manufacturing of outrage.”...
abstract: Pres Obama says delivery of $400 million cash to Iran on same day in January 2016 that country released four detained American citizens was coincidence; rebukes critics who suggests money was ransom payment, explaining money was returned to Iran after lifting of sanctions according to terms of international nuclear accord.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: The president called the uproar over the payment, which was made public at the time as part of a landmark nuclear pact, “the manufacturing of outrage.”

headline.main: $400 Million to Iran Was Not a Ransom, Obama Says
headline.print_headline: $400 Million Iran Payment Not Ransom, Obama Says
